intro: Fumaria agraria subsp. major, commonly known as the greater celandine, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Papaveraceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, disturbed soils across Europe and parts of Asia. The plant features elongated, ribbed stems and basal leaves that are pinnately lobed. Its flowers are yellow and borne in clusters, and it produces elongated, cylindrical pods containing numerous seeds. It is often found in fields, along roadsides, and in woodland edges.
